pgTitle: List of rail accidents in the United Kingdom

rows.text: {{dts|format=dmy|1948|04|17}}

Winsford rail accident (1948), Cheshire: Glasgow to {{rws|Euston}} train was stopped by passenger inappropriately pulling communication cord. Following train hit stopped train due to a signalman's error.
{{dts|format=dmy|1948|05|19}}
Wath Road Junction: Buckled track derailed locomotive; train rolled down embankment.
{{dts|format=dmy|1948|11|30}}

Stockport Viaduct, Cheshire/Lancashire: In dense fog, a stationary passenger train from Manchester to Crewe and Disley was run into by following passenger train from Manchester to Buxton, which had passed a signal at danger. Two rearmost coaches of standing train were telescoped.
{{dts|format=dmy|1948|12|16}}
|| ||{{rws|Mangotsfield}}: A 16-year old railway employee was hit by a mail train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1949|06|23}}
Train fire near Penmanshiel Tunnel: two coaches of Edinburgh to King's Cross express destroyed by fire.
{{dts|format=dmy|1949|9|30}}
|| ||{{rws|Mangotsfield}}: A train fireman was hit by an express train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1950|05|13}}
Preston, Lancashire: Passenger train from Southport collided with a stationary light engine after passing signals at danger
{{dts|format=dmy|1950|06|08}}
near Beattock Summit: Fire on train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1950|08|27}}
Penmaenmawr crash (1950), north Wales: Up Irish Mail sleeper train from {{rws|Holyhead}} to {{rws|Euston}} collided with shunting locomotive at night due to signalman's error.
{{dts|format=dmy|1950|09|07}}
Hopworthy, Holsworthy, Devon: Train hit tractor on farm crossing.
{{dts|format=dmy|1951|03|16}}

Doncaster rail crash, West Riding: Southbound express passenger train to {{rws|London King's Cross}} partly derailed on a poorly maintained crossover shortly after leaving Doncaster, one coach destroyed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1951|08|17}}
Newcastle rail crash between electric units due to starting when signal at danger.
{{dts|format=dmy|1951|09|21}}
Weedon crash (1951), Northamptonshire: Jammed locomotive axlebox caused derailment of {{rws|Liverpool Lime Street}} to {{rws|Euston}} passenger train at speed
{{dts|format=dmy|1952|04|18}}
Blea Moor (Settle-Carlisle Line): Brake rod on locomotive tender detached and derailed train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1952|10|08}}

Harrow and Wealdstone rail disaster, Middlesex: driver ignored signals, his train struck the rear of a stationary train, a third train travelling in the opposite direction struck the wreckage.{{sfn|Nock|Cooper|1987|pp=161–164}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1952|10|25}}
Crewkerne: Brake rod on locomotive tender detached and debris flew through coach.
{{dts|format=dmy|1953|05|05}}
Ystrad Caron level-crossing near Tregaron: van with six occupants on crossing hit by non-scheduled train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1953|08|15}}

Irk Valley Junction rail crash near Manchester: 5-car EMU train collided with steam-hauled train at Irk Valley Junction, Collyhurst, caused by a signalman's error and driver inattention.{{citation needed|date=March 2018}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1953|10|28}}
Goswick derailment: Glasgow to Colchester express passenger train derailed at Goswick.
{{dts|format=dmy|1953|12|17}}
{{rws|Longniddry}} station: A section of track fell off a down freight train on to the up line derailing 12:41 am parcel train from Edinburgh to Kings Cross.{{citation needed|date=March 2018}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1955|01|23}}

Sutton Coldfield rail crash: Train on diversionary route, pilot driver with route knowledge was unfamiliar with type of locomotive, speed on curve, train strewn over platforms.{{citation needed|date=March 2018}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1955|05|28}}
Wormit, Fife: Train derailed at excessive speed in tunnel, overturning onto a platform at Wormit Station. Locomotive fireman and two passengers on footplate killed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1955|11|20}}
Milton rail crash, Oxfordshire: Passenger train from Treherbert to London Paddington derailed whilst passing over a crossover at excessive speed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1955|12|02}}
Barnes rail crash: rear-end collision because signalman error.
{{dts|format=dmy|1955|12|22}}
Luton station accident (1955): Northbound passenger train in rear-end collision with stationary northbound passenger train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1956|09|06}}
Ludlow, Shropshire: Collision due to driver error.
{{dts|format=dmy|1957|01|07}}
Welwyn Garden City rail crash (1957), Hertfordshire: Signals ignored in fog, rear-end collision with another passenger train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1957|02|09}}

|||| Chapel-en-le-Frith rail crash, Derbyshire: Runaway freight train rear-end collision with another freight train due to brake failure. Deceased driver of runaway train posthumously awarded George Cross.
{{dts|format=dmy|1957|12|04}}

Lewisham rail crash, south-east London: Missed signals in fog, rear-end collision with another passenger train. Overbridge fell on wreckage when bridge's abutment was struck by derailing locomotive and coaches.{{sfn|Nock|Cooper|1987|p=164}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1958|01|30}}
Dagenham East rail crash: Signal passed at danger in thick fog by passenger train, rear-end collision with preceding passenger train
{{dts|format=dmy|1958|07|04}}
Maze Hill station: Signal passed at danger, head-on collision of 4-car EMU from Gravesend Central to Charing Cross with 9-coach empty passenger stock train being shunted by a steam locomotive
{{dts|format=dmy|1958|08|25}}

Eastbourne station rail crash, 22 serious injuries, 19 minor: Sleeper train from Glasgow passed signal at danger, collided head-on with 12-car EMU from Ore to London Bridge as the latter is leaving platform at the station.
{{dts|format=dmy|1958|11|19}}

Hitchin rail crash, No fatalities, 5 minor injuries: The 3:25am London to Peterborough freight train collided with the rear of the 2:28am London to Peterborough freight train which had been held at the down main 'Home' signal. Some wagons derailed across the up main and were almost immediately hit by the 10:35pm Leeds to London freight train. A stationary light engine on the adjacent up slow was also struck and overturned. Official Report
{{dts|format=dmy|1959|10|26}}
Ardsley: Collision due to inadequate signaling arrangements.
{{dts|format=dmy|1960|01|21}}
Settle rail crash: Locomotive slide bar fell off due to failed bolts; connecting rod became detached destroying adjacent track; oncoming goods train derailed into side of passenger train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1960|11|24}}
Between Pontrhydyfen and Cwmavon, Glamorgan: Head-on collision between 3-car passenger DMU travelling from Swansea High Street to Barry Island and a runaway steam-hauled goods train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1960|12|02}}
North Belton level-crossing, near Dunbar, East Lothian: Car with five occupants hit by two freight trains on a level-crossing.
{{dts|format=dmy|1961|02|08}}
{{rws|Royton}}, Lancashire: Runaway train crashed through buffers and demolished a pair of terraced houses.
{{dts|format=dmy|1961|02|13}}

{{rws|Baschurch}}, Shropshire: Signalman's error caused collision between passenger train travelling at {{nowrap|40–45 mph}} and freight train locomotive that was shunting its wagons into a siding. The locomotive, tender and a stores van of the passenger train overturned and ended up on the station platform where the stores van burst into flames and burned out.
{{dts|format=dmy|1961|04|18}}
Pitsea, Essex: steam-hauled passenger train from London Fenchurch Street to Shoeburyness overturned after running over catch points.
{{dts|format=dmy|1961|07|16}}
Singleton Bank rail crash, Weeton, Lancashire: signalman let train enter section of line under engineer's possession, collided with ballast train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1962|06|03}}
Lincoln rail crash: Excess speed on curve.
{{dts|format=dmy|1962|12|26}}
Coppenhall Junction rail disaster, Cheshire: Express hit a second express from the rear. Driver passed signal at danger as phone was out of order, hit stationary train in next section.
{{dts|format=dmy|1963|01|25}}
Bracebridge Gas Sidings, Lincoln: 2-car DMU travelling from Grantham to Lincoln Central collided with a stationary steam locomotive.
{{dts|format=dmy|1963|07|31}}
Between Picton and Welbury, North Riding: Freight train ran into the back of another freight train due to a signal passed at danger.
{{dts|format=dmy|1963|08|15}}
Knowle and Dorridge rail crash: Pullman train from {{rws|Birmingham Snow Hill}} to London Paddington ran into freight train being shunted across its path due to signalman's error.
{{dts|format=dmy|1963|12|06}}
Stanton Gate, Stapleford, Nottinghamshire: two freight trains collided due one passing a signal at danger.
{{dts|format=dmy|1963|12|13}}
Shoreditch, east London: Rear coach of a {{rws|Liverpool Street}} to {{rws|Gidea Park}} train derailed shortly after leaving terminus and is struck by a train travelling in the opposite direction.
{{dts|format=dmy|1964|03|05}}
Itchingfield Junction, West Sussex: Collision between up goods train (Brighton to Three Bridges, diverted via Steyning line), which overran signals, and down goods train (Three Bridges to Chichester)
{{dts|format=dmy|1964|05|28}}
{{rws|Cheadle Hulme}}, Cheshire: Train derailed crossing a temporary railway bridge over road widening work at well in excess of the temporary {{nowrap|10 mph}} speed limit.
{{dts|format=dmy|1964|06|03}}

Bradford Exchange station, West Riding: Driver of DMU train suffered heart attack, train ran out of control on steep downhill approach to station and collided with a stationary mail train at platform.
{{dts|format=dmy|1964|06|25}}
Nantwich station level-crossing, Nantwich, Cheshire: Express passenger train from Plymouth to Manchester passed signal at danger and crashed through level-crossing gates into 2 road vehicles.
{{dts|format=dmy|1964|10|05}}

Finsbury Park: Two passenger trains collided in dense fog when the green signal was given in error. The trains were the 08:20 Kings Cross – Doncaster and 09:00 Kings Cross – Newcastle. The only injury was to the driver, who had to be cut from the train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1964|10|10}}

Millbrook, Bedfordshire: Eight-car DMU from St. Pancras to Bedford travelling at 60 mph when a fire broke out under the last coach. One passenger died and others injured after jumping from moving train to escape fire.
{{dts|format=dmy|1965|01|11}}
Coton Hill rail crash, Shrewsbury: Driver of goods train failed to obey stop sign, derailed on trap points and crashed through Coton Hill signal box.
{{dts|format=dmy|1965|03|29}}
Elm Park, near Dagenham, Essex: Derailment- Unknown persons placed obstruction on line, derailed London Fenchurch St. to Shoeburyness passenger train travelling at {{nowrap|70 mph}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1965|05|20}}
{{rws|Hest Bank}}, Lancashire: Derailment caused by broken rail.
{{dts|format=dmy|1965|09|04}}
{{rws|Holyhead}} station, Anglesey: local passenger train from Bangor collided with stationary boat train to Euston due to inattention and lack of caution of driver and fireman.
{{dts|format=dmy|1965|09|22}}

Roundstone level-crossing, Angmering, Sussex: In thick fog a 4-car EMU passenger train crashed through crossing gates, closed across line in error by crossing keeper, and collided with a Southdown double-deck bus traversing the crossing, pushing it 54 yards along the track. Bus destroyed by fire.
{{dts|format=dmy|1965|12|17}}
Bridgend, Glamorgan: Locomotive derailed due to landslide whilst hauling train of empty passenger coaches, and this in turn was run into by a freight train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1966|05|13}}

Acton Grange Junction, Warrington, Cheshire: Rear section of moving freight train became uncoupled on gradient in the dark and ran downhill into an oncoming London Euston to Stranraer boat train, killing the driver and co-driver of the latter train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1967|02|28}}

Stechford rail crash, Birmingham: Misunderstood hand signal coupled with an unauthorised movement of a diesel locomotive crossing the running lines into the path of multiple unit passenger train travelling at {{nowrap|60 mph}}.
{{dts|format=dmy|1967|03|05}}
Connington South rail crash, Huntingdonshire: Signal operator wilfully defeated interlocking and moved facing points while passenger train was passing over them.
{{dts|format=dmy|1967|07|11}}
Maidstone East station, Kent: Freight train passed signal at danger and ran into rear of stationary passenger train; error by guard resulted in inadequate brake power; excessive speed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1967|07|31}}
Thirsk rail crash (1967): Derailment of the rear portion of a freight train led to wagon fouling adjacent track, passenger express ran into wagon at approximately {{nowrap|50 mph}}.
{{dts|format=dmy|1967|09|27}}
Foxhall Junction, Didcot: Derailment caused by train driver driving at excessive speed through crossover. (O. S. Nock was a passenger).{{sfn|Nock|Cooper|1987|pp=166–16}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1967|11|05}}
Hither Green rail crash: Hastings to Charing Cross train derailed at {{nowrap|70 mph}} due to broken rail.{{sfn|Nock|Cooper|1987|pp=173–179}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1968|01|06}}
Hixon rail crash, Staffordshire: Express passenger train collided at level crossing with road-transporter carrying 110-ton transformer.{{sfn|Nock|Cooper|1987|pp=180–191}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1968|03|11}}
Peterborough North: Freight train ran into back of another freight train due to driver error.
{{dts|format=dmy|1968|03|23}}
Hatfield, Hertfordshire: Train driver error caused freight train to crash through buffers on a spur line and into an over-line bridge abutment at about {{nowrap|30 mph}}.
{{dts|format=dmy|1968|04|16}}

Beckingham, Gainsborough, Lincolnshire: Stalled car hit by train on half barrier level-crossing situated between Gainsborough Trent junction and Beckingham (the crossing was subsequently closed and a by-pass built). All five occupants in the car were killed, including three children.
{{dts|format=dmy|1968|06|12}}
Sandridge, Hertfordshire: Fire on diesel multiple unit after gearbox failure damaged fuel tank; poor maintenance.
{{dts|format=dmy|1968|09|09}}
Castlecary, Stirlingshire: Locomotive running light ran into the back of a stationary six-car DMU standing at a signal.
{{dts|format=dmy|1969|01|04}}
Marden rail crash, {{rws|Marden}}, Kent: Express passenger train ran past signal at danger in fog and collided with parcels train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1969|03|08}}

Ashchurch, Gloucestershire: Bristol to Newcastle upon Tyne express passenger train hit part of a freight train which was derailing due to travelling at excess speed. The sides of several coaches on the passenger train were torn off and two coaches derailed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1969|04|08}}
Monmore Green, Wolverhampton: Freight train struck head-on by a passenger train which passed signal at danger; subsequent fire.
{{dts|format=dmy|1969|05|07}}
Morpeth rail crash (1969), Northumberland: Driver inattention led to night sleeper train derailing on tight curve at excessive speed ({{nowrap|80 mph}}).
{{dts|format=dmy|1969|12|31}}
Roade Junction, Northamptonshire: 4-car Coventry to London Euston EMU passenger train collided with a derailed freight train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1970|05|20}}
Audenshaw Junction rail crash, Lancashire: Points changed under train; signalman tampered with equipment to speed up working.
{{dts|format=dmy|1971|02|26}}
{{rws|Sheerness-on-Sea}}, Kent: 10 coach EMU passenger train overran buffers, 13 on train injured, woman waiting in booking hall killed. Driver taken ill.
{{dts|format=dmy|1971|05|18}}

Middlesbrough, North Riding: Freight train ran into rear of stationary freight train standing at a signal having not been warned by signalman, who should have refused permission to enter that section, of latter's presence.
{{dts|format=dmy|1971|07|02}}
Tattenhall Junction, near Chester, Cheshire: School excursion train derailed; buckled track.
{{dts|format=dmy|1972|05|08}}
Chester General station rail crash, Chester, Cheshire: Freight train vacuum brakes not connected, runaway train hit empty passenger stock in station.
{{dts|format=dmy|1972|06|01}}
Eltham Well Hall rail crash, south-east London: Excessive speed on curve: driver intoxicated, assistant driver lacked route knowledge.
{{dts|format=dmy|1972|12|16}}

Copyhold Junction, just north of Haywards Heath on London to Brighton Line: Slow train from Haywards Heath passed signal at danger, moving onto through line from local line, struck by Victoria-bound fast train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1973|08|30}}
Shields Junction near Glasgow: Collision between two passenger trains followed by fire; no clear cause – driver possibly suffered heart attack.
{{dts|format=dmy|1973|12|19}}
Ealing rail crash, west London: Battery box door fell open, hit lineside equipment which operated points under train.{{sfn|Slater|1974|p=111}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1974|06|11}}
||{{rws|Pollokshields East}}, Glasgow: EMU passenger train passed signal at danger and collided with DMU passenger train; driver error.
{{dts|format=dmy|1975|01|23}}
Watford Junction rail crash, Hertfordshire: Express derailed by a steel stillage that had fallen from freight train, then hit by another express.
{{dts|format=dmy|1975|06|06}}
Nuneaton rail crash, Warwickshire: Excessive speed caused derailment of sleeper train. Temporary speed limit equipment faulty and inattention by driver.
{{dts|format=dmy|1975|10|26}}
Lunan Bay, Angus: Collision of recovery locomotive and failed train (10.15 Aberdeen to London King's Cross). Confusion over exact location of failed train and excessive speed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1976|01|03}}
Worcester Tunnel Junction, Worcester: Locomotive running light runs into the rear of a parcels train due to driver failure to comply with signalman's instructions.
{{dts|format=dmy|1976|12|03}}
Chivers Occupation level-crossing, Cambridgeshire: Passenger train collided with lorry on unmanned level crossing.
{{dts|format=dmy|1977|07|02}}
Between Wolverton and Bletchley. Derailment of express parcels train due to undetected continuous-welded rail buckle in hot weather.
{{dts|format=dmy|1977|09|05}}
Farnley Junction, Leeds: Signalling problems resulting from technical work by engineering staff lead to head-on collision between passenger train and mail train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1978|07|06}}
Taunton train fire, Somerset: Dirty linen stacked against electric heater, (victims died from carbon monoxide poisoning); locked doors.{{sfn|Vaughan|2003|pp=27–34}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1978|12|19}}
Between Hassocks and {{rws|Preston Park}}, Sussex: Train ran into rear of another due to incorrect passing of both a caution signal and next signal (showing no aspect), as per rule book requirements.
{{dts|format=dmy|1979|03|01}}

Naas level-crossing, Lydney, Gloucestershire: Lorry crossed unmanned level-crossing in front of Cardiff to Newcastle upon Tyne passenger train travelling at {{nowrap|60 mph}}. Train crew and lorry driver killed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1979|02|25}}
Hilsea, Portsea Island: Train struck overhanging crane on adjacent track.
{{dts|format=dmy|1979|04|16}}
Paisley Gilmour Street rail crash, Renfrewshire: Inattention by driver ("ding-ding, and away"); head-on collision.
{{dts|format=dmy|1979|08|13}}

Bushbury Junction, West Midlands: Camshaft failure of a switch diamond crossing caused the approaching Manchester Piccadilly to Birmingham International express to derail at around {{nowrap|35 mph}}, train lightly loaded. Driver did not return to his duties and died 1 year after the incident.
{{dts|format=dmy|1979|10|22}}
Invergowrie rail crash, Perth and Kinross: Train stopped due to traction motor fire, following train ran into rear, poorly maintained signalling equipment.{{sfn|Nock|Cooper|1987|pp=41–44}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1980|02|16}}

{{rws|Bushey}}, Hertfordshire: On a section of continuous welded rail a welded joint failed. 20:25 {{rws|Euston}} to Manchester Piccadilly derailed at {{nowrap|96 mph}}. Coaches derailed blocking the adjacent Up Fast Line and Watford DC Line.
{{dts|format=dmy|1980|07|09}}
Holborn rail crash, central London: Inattention by driver, signal passed at danger, rear-end collision.
{{dts|format=dmy|1980|11|07}}
Crewe, Cheshire: Freight train ran into rear of another freight train for reasons unknown.
{{dts|format=dmy|1981|12|08}}
Ulleskelf, East Riding: Broken rail lead to derailment of York to Liverpool passenger train. Two rearmost coaches rolled down steep embankment.
{{dts|format=dmy|1981|12|11}}
Seer Green rail crash, Buckinghamshire: Signalman misread equipment, excess speed after driver authorised to pass signal at danger, rear-end collision.
{{dts|format=dmy|1982|05|04}}
Nairn's level-crossing, Forteviot, Perth & Kinross: Agricultural tractor and trailer grounded on farm crossing hit by express passenger train at {{nowrap|55 mph}}. Entire train derailed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1982|12|09}}

Linslade Tunnel, West Coast Main Line. At 2am a north bound passenger train derailed when it struck permanent way material that had fallen from a previous train. Locomotive hit bridge pier, driver killed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1983|02|03}}
Elgin, Moray: Broken rail leads to derailment of Aberdeen to Inverness passenger train, rearmost coach turned on its side and slid about 100 metres.
{{dts|format=dmy|1983|12|09}}
Wrawby Junction rail crash, Lincolnshire: Passenger DMU train hit and partially derailed by freight train mistakenly signalled to proceed whilst line ahead in use by passenger train.
{{dts|format=dmy|1984|06|24}}
Morpeth rail crash, Northumberland: Excessive speed, sleeping car train derailed, driver intoxicated.{{sfn|Vaughan|2003|pp=35–39}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1984|07|30}}
Polmont rail crash, near Falkirk: Leading DBSO of Edinburgh to Glasgow train hit stray cow on line, whole train derailed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1984|10|11}}
Wembley Central rail crash, London: Collision due to signal passed at danger. Driver mentally incapacitated by medical condition.
{{dts|format=dmy|1984|11|23}}
Paddington Station approaches, London: Excessive speed approaching Paddington. Penzance-Paddington sleeper derailed, locomotive 50041 extensively damaged.
{{dts|format=dmy|1984|12|04}}
Eccles rail crash (1984), Greater Manchester: Signal passed at danger, rear-end collision.
{{dts|format=dmy|1984|12|20}}
Summit tunnel fire, Todmorden, West Yorkshire: Faulty axle box caused derailment of petrol tank wagons in tunnel, fire burned for over 36 hours.
{{dts|format=dmy|1985|05|31}}

Battersea Park Station, London: Gatwick Express passenger train passed signal at danger in fine, sunny conditions and ran into rear of commuter train that was accelerating away from another signal at which it had been held.
{{dts|format=dmy|1985|11|06}}

Copyhold Junction, near Haywards Heath, Sussex: 4-car EMU passenger train passed signal at danger at night, passed over points and collided head-on with another 4-car EMU passenger train travelling in opposite direction.
{{dts|format=dmy|1986|03|09}}

Chinley, Derbyshire: Multiple errors by inexperienced signalman led to passenger train being sent onto line where two coupled locomotives were waiting. Collision despite driver of lead waiting locomotives starting to reverse when he saw other train approaching.
{{dts|format=dmy|1986|06|15}}

Motherwell: Defective and poorly maintained track coupled with hot weather. At approximately 16.31 the 16.10 Glasgow Central to London Euston passenger train became derailed on the approach to Motherwell Station.{{citation needed|date=November 2011}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1986|07|26}}
Lockington rail crash, East Yorkshire: Road vehicle on level-crossing.{{citation needed|date=March 2018}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1986|09|19}}
Colwich rail crash, Staffordshire: Head-on collision at converging route. Driver misread signals after failing to read a notification regarding recent signalling changes.{{sfn|Vaughan|2003|pp=44–52}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1986|09|11}}

Bridgeton, Glasgow: 2 empty passenger trains collided in tunnel during shunting movement killing 2 crew. Signaller cleared signal for reversing train which did not pass signal after 5 minutes, then set new route for incoming train. Reversing train passed signal, now at danger, and collided with incoming train. Deceased guard did not keep adequate lookout, signaller did not check driver of reversing train knew signal had been reset to danger.
{{dts|format=dmy|1986|10|16}}
||23|| ||Kensal Green rail crash: Network SouthEast Class 313 collided with rear of Bakerloo line train following driver's misinterpretation of a signal.
{{dts|format=dmy|1987|10|19}}
|| ||River Towy rail crash, near Llandeilo: flood washed bridge away; train fell into river.{{sfn|Vaughan|2003|pp=53–61}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1987|10|}}
Forest Gate, London: two trains collided.
{{dts|format=dmy|1988|11|11}}
St. Helens rail crash, Merseyside: Train derailed leaving station.
{{dts|format=dmy|1988|12|12}}
Clapham Junction rail crash, London: Rear-end collision, oncoming train ran into wreckage: wrong-side signalling failure due to wiring error.{{sfn|Vaughan|2003|pp=75–84}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1989|03|04}}
Purley Station rail crash, London: Missed distant signal, overshot signal at danger; rear-end collision, part of train down embankment.{{sfn|Vaughan|2003|pp=88–93}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1989|03|06}}
|| ||Glasgow Bellgrove rail crash: Inattention by driver ("ding-ding, and away"); head-on collision.{{sfn|Vaughan|2003|pp=94–100}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1989|08|05}}
|| ||{{rws|West Ealing}}: Train collided with a piece of rail left on the track, probably by vandals, and the locomotive was derailed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1989|11|30}}
{{rws|Newcastle}}: Two expresses collided outside the station.
{{dts|format=dmy|1990|08|04}}
Stafford rail crash (1990): Train signalled into an occupied section, rear-end collision, alcohol and excessive working hours possible causes.
{{dts|format=dmy|1991|01|08}}
Cannon Street Station rail crash, London: Passenger train hit buffer stop.
{{dts|format=dmy|1991|07|21}}
Newton (South Lanarkshire) rail accident, Glasgow: head-on collision at junction.{{sfn|Vaughan|2003|pp=105–108}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1991|12|03}}
Appleford level crossing, near Didcot. Road vehicle on crossing.
{{dts|format=dmy|1991|12|07}}
Severn Tunnel rail crash: Rear-end collision, cause uncertain.{{sfn|Vaughan|2003|pp=109–121}}
{{dts|format=dmy|1992|11|13}}
Morpeth rail crash 1992, Northumberland: Light engine hit train in rear, driver misunderstood signaller's instruction.
{{dts|format=dmy|1993|09|06}}
{{rws|Maidstone East}}, Kent: Derailment due to driver error, excessive speed.
{{dts|format=dmy|1994|06|25}}
Greenock rail crash: Train derailed by vandals placing concrete blocks on track.
{{dts|format=dmy|1994|07|27}}
Morpeth rail crash 1994, Northumberland: excessive speed on curve.
{{dts|format=dmy|1994|10|15}}
Cowden rail crash, Kent: Signal passed at danger; head-on collision.{{sfn|Vaughan|2003|pp=122–127}}
